name: Baked Cod
description: Lemon and herb marinated cod fillets, perfectly baked in the oven. Lean, healthy, and ready in 20 minutes.

instructions.instruction: Remove cod from fridge 10 minutes early. Pat both sides dry with paper towels.
instructions.tip: Dry fish sears better and doesn't stick.

instructions.instruction: Line baking dish with parchment paper or lightly grease.
Place fish in dish with at least 2cm space between fillets.
Drizzle olive oil evenly over each fillet.

instructions.tip: Lemon adds flavor and keeps fish white.

instructions.instruction: Sprinkle salt, pepper, and paprika evenly.
Place lemon slices on top of fish.
instructions.tip: Lemon slices add both flavor and visual appeal.
Butter melts to create natural sauce.

instructions.instruction: Bake on middle rack for 12-15 minutes.
instructions.tip: Fish should be opaque white and flake easily. Don't overcook!

instructions.instruction: Remove from oven. Spoon pan juices over fish.
Sprinkle fresh parsley and serve immediately.

tips: Cod is one of the leanest white fish - perfect for diets.
Internal temperature should reach 145°F - use meat thermometer.
If using frozen cod, thaw completely first.
Different fillets may vary in thickness - remove thinner ones early.
This method works for sea bass, tilapia, or any white fish.
storageInfo: Refrigerate for 2 days. Best served fresh.
servingSuggestion: Serve with steamed vegetables, quinoa, or mashed potatoes. Use bread to soak up pan juices!
variations: Mediterranean: Add cherry tomatoes, olives, and capers.
Pesto: Spread pesto instead of olive oil.
Parmesan crusted: Top with parmesan and breadcrumbs.
